page.title: 13THE CHAGALL WINDOWS TUDELEY
page.content: THE GLORIOUS STAINED GLASS WINDOWS IN ALL SAINTS CHURCH WERE PRESENTED BY SIR HARRY AND LADY D'AVIGDOR GOLDSMID IN MEMORY OF THEIR DAUGHTER SARAH WHO WAS DROWNED IN A SAILING ACCIDENT OFF RYE IN 1963. THE EAST WINDOW DEPICTS SARAH CRADLED IN A TURBULENT SEA BELOW A RED HORSE OF HAPPINESS,SURROUNDED BY GRIEVING FIGURES. A LADDER RISES TO A CRUCIFIED CHRIST.{MARC CHAGALL (1887 - {1985) DESIGNED THE 8 WINDOWS WHICH {WERE MADE IN FRANCE BY CHARLES MARC. } MANY ARE PREDOMINENTLY BLUE. THE NORTH WINDOWS ARE VERY DARK,BECOMING LIGHTER WITH YELLOWS AND WHITES. ABSTRACT IN DESIGN THEY INCLUDE TINY BIRDS, ANIMAL HEADS AND FIGURES WITHIN SWIRLING PATTERNS. FOUR MORE WINDOWS FOR THE CHANCEL,AT PRESENT ON DISPLAY IN PHILADELPHIA,WILL SOON BE INSTALLED.IT WILL BE{THE ONLY CHURCH IN BRITAIN {WITH A COMPLETE SET OF CHAGALL WINDOWS
